title: Euro 2020, Women's Champions League and Reading – Football Weekly Extra
text:
Max Rushden , Barry Glendenning , Lars Sivertsen and Faye Carruthers discuss Tyrone Mings’s starring role for England against Bulgaria, Ireland’s Groundhog Day, a Faroese player in Bristol and a Canadian ‘winless skid’

Join the conversation on Facebook, Twitter and email.

We start by discussing England’s 6-0 win over Bulgaria – focusing on events on the pitch. For our special episode discussing what happened in the stands, including potential paths forward, click here.

We round up the rest of the Euro 2020 action, look ahead to this weekend’s Premier League matches and decide which footballer we’d most like to be glued to.



Back on Monday.

PS: we have just announced a show at the Science Museum, entitled Football Weekly versus Science. Join Max, Barry, Barney Ronay and Nicky Bandini by clicking here.

PPS: also freshly announced, our Christmas special – this time taking place at Indigo at the O2. Max, Barry, Jonathan Wilson, Elis James. More info and tickets here.

PPPS: we are also returning to Leeds in December – Max, Lars Sivertsen, Jonathan Wilson plus one more TBA, click here.

PPPPS: if you’re on the other side of the Irish Sea, come and see us in Dublin! Max and Barry plus two more TBA. Our first show is sold out, but keep your eyes peeled - there may be exciting news soon.
description: Max Rushden, Barry Glendenning, Lars Sivertsen and Faye Carruthers discuss Tyrone Mings’s starring role for England against Bulgaria, Ireland’s Groundhog Day, a Faroese player in Bristol and a Canadian ‘winless skid’
